short_summary: Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada (AAFC) seeks to establish a contract for the supply of bulk granular fertilizer products to the Brandon Research and Development Centre in Brandon, Manitoba
description: AMENDMENT TO CLOSING TIME: Please disregard the Ariba Discovery posting response deadline closing time ...
full_summary:
**Government Tender Announcement: Fertilizer**

* **Tender Reference:** WS3576812910-Doc3576934329
* **Amendment Number:** 1
* **Publication Date:** October 3rd, 2022
* **Tender Closing Date:** October 28th, 2022, 2:00pm EDT
* **Tender Status:** Expired

**Procurement Information:**

* **UNSPSC Code:** 10171600
* **Description:** Chemical fertilizers and plant nutrients
* **Procurement Category:** GD
* **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open Bidding
* **Selection Criteria:** Lowest Price
* **Notice Type:** Request for Standing Offer

**Trade Agreements:**

* This tender is open to contractors who participate in the following trade agreements:
	+ Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
	+ Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
	+ Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA)
	+ Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
	+ Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
	+ Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
	+ Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
	+ World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
	+ Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
	+ Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
	+ Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
	+ Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)

**Contracting Information:**

* **Contracting Entity:** Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **Contracting Entity Address:** 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec K1A 0S5, Canada
* **End User Entity:** Department of Agriculture and Agri-Food (AAFC)
* **End User Entity Address:** K.W. Neatby Bldg, 960 Carling Ave, Ottawa, Ontario K1Y4X2, Canada

**Tender Description:**

Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada (AAFC) invites bids for the supply of bulk granular fertilizer products to the Brandon Research and Development Centre (RDC) in Brandon, Manitoba. The requirement is for a period of one year, with an option to extend for an additional two, one-year periods. Bidders must submit all required supporting documentation and their
